final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures matching the precision of the initial concentration and volumes in the problem statement.

method: Using the dilution equation c1V1 = c2V2, the initial concentration (0.200 mol dm-3) and initial volume (25.0 cm3) are used to find the new concentration after dilution to 250.0 cm3. Rearranging: c2 = c1V1/V2 = (0.200 mol dm-3 Ã— 25.0 cm3) / 250.0 cm3 = 0.0200 mol dm-3. The dilution factor is 10-fold, so concentration decreases by factor of 10.
checks: Dilution factor check: 250.0 cm3 / 25.0 cm3 = 10, so concentration should be 0.200/10 = 0.0200 mol dm-3 which matches the calculated result.
